duties_responsibilities.duty: Deliver a comprehensive academic program tailored to each student's strengths, needs, grade level, and functioning level.
Maintain a structured, therapeutic, and positive educational environment.
Write and follow lesson/unit plans aligned with educational assessment and school curriculum guidelines.
Provide clear expectations, feedback, and background information to any assigned classroom assistant.
Maintain timely written attendance and grade records as well as any additional educational record-keeping responsibilities.
Instruct students in all assigned academic subjects and track students’ verbal and non-verbal behavior based on I.E.P. goals.
Plan and supervise educational field trips and special events.
Meet with other school and clinical staff regularly to discuss educational and behavioral progress of students.
Ensures adequate visual and auditory supervision of all assigned students during school hours.
Report any significant changes in behavior, educational performance, and medical or psychiatric condition.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree and Three (3) years’ experience teaching children or youth with severe emotional/behavioral challenges in full-time academic setting or Master’s degree and Two (2) years’ experience teaching children or youth with severe emotional/behavioral challenges in a full-time academic setting
